title: Appomattox Court House National Historical Park: Education
body: Education          Teachers- thinking about bringing your students to the park or looking for classroom activities and resources?       Click on the categories to the left to learn about the programs offered for field trips, access lesson plans and materials, and link to the park's educational on-line activities.                  Programs: Appomattox Court House National Historical Park offers school groups a wide variety of special educational programs. In order to ensure your visit goes the way you like, click on these links: program descriptions, reservations and fee waiver, and directions.  Lesson plans: Click on Curriculum Materials on the left for ready to go lesson plans. These lesson plans are standards aligned and available as a pdf for teachers to print out. By clicking on Curriculum Materials you will have access to many useful materials and resources for purposeful pre and post visit classroom exercises, as well.  On-line activities: For engaging and educational ideas to do over the internet in the classroom or at home, click on Curriculum Materials on the left.  For inquiries, please contact Educational Resources Ranger Brandon Chamberlain preferably via e-mail or at 434-352-8987 x 231  Mail may be addressed to: Appomattox Court House NHP Attn: Brandon Chamberlain P.O. Box 218 Appomattox, VA 24522
